Definition Class Reference

Constructs that declare entities as they also define them. More...

#include <Definition.h>

Inheritance diagram for Definition:

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

virtual void identify (std::vector< int > &id) const

Public Attributes

Declaration * declRef
 Reference to declaration of defined entity. If there is no preceding declaration, then declRef can be set to NULL or it can be created explicitly.

Detailed Description

Constructs that declare entities as they also define them.

C++

  • example: 
     1| int foo();
 2| 
  | ...
10| 
11| int foo()   // this->declRef = declaration on line 1, this->identifierName = "foo", this->type = "int"
12| {
  |     ...
21| }

Member Data Documentation

Declaration* Definition::declRef

Reference to declaration of defined entity. If there is no preceding declaration, then declRef can be set to NULL or it can be created explicitly.

See also:
Declaration
